problem_text:
b) Let E_n be a free locally nilpotent n-Engel group on countably many generators, and let π(E_n) be the set of prime divisors of the orders of elements of the periodic part of E_n. It is known that 2, 3, 5 ∈ π(E_4). Is it true that π(E_n) = π(E_{n+1}) for all sufficiently large n?
Yu. V. Sosnovski˘ı
